Argument Matching with Defaults

Source: R/utilities.R
match.call.defaults.Rd

Expansion of match.call to include default formal values.

match.call.defaults(
  definition = sys.function(sys.parent()),
  call = sys.call(sys.parent()),
  expand.dots = TRUE,
  envir = parent.frame(2L)
)

Arguments

definition

A function, by default the function from which match.call.defaults is called.

call

An unevaluated call to the function specified by definition, as generated by call.

expand.dots

logical defining if arguments matching ... in the call be included or left as a ... argument

envir

An environment, from which the ... in call are retrieved, if any.

References

DesignLibrary's match.call.defaults function.
Stack overflow post reply by Roland. URL

Examples

 fun <- function(arg1 = "ok", ...) {
   match.call.defaults()
 }
 fun()
 fun(arg2 = "hi")
